Cancer is a disease characterized by the uncontrolled growth and spread of abnormal cells in the body. Normally, cells grow, divide, and die in an orderly manner. However, cancerous cells continue to grow and divide instead of dying, forming masses of tissue called tumors. These tumors can invade nearby tissues and may spread to other parts of the body through the bloodstream or lymphatic system, a process known as metastasis.\\n\\nThere are many types of cancer, each named after the organ or cell type where it begins, such as lung cancer, breast cancer, and skin cancer. Cancer can develop due to genetic factors, lifestyle choices (like smoking or diet), environmental exposures (such as radiation or certain chemicals), or infections. The disease is often treated with surgery, radiation therapy, chemotherapy, immunotherapy, or a combination of these methods, depending on the type and stage of cancer. Early detection and treatment are key to improving the chances of survival.
Stem canker, leaf lesions, black rot, blight

Alternia is a genus that encompasses 299 species of fungi. They are considered to be one of at least 20% of yield loss. Alternaria fungi are known to affect a variety of vegetables, including carrots, pumpkins, potatoes, and tomatoes. Moreover, it infects citrus plants, roses, wheat, and tobacco. Most plants affected by these fungi develop stem canker, leaf lesions, black rot, leaf blight, and ringspot disease. Alternaria fungi don’t pose a threat to plants only- they also cause allergic reactions, hay fever, and asthma in humans.

Berikut beberapa saran dan penanganannya :\nPotong dan buang daun atau bagian tanaman yang menunjukkan gejala infeksi seperti bercak coklat atau hitam yang berkembang menjadi cincin konsentris.\nBuang dedaunan yang gugur atau material tanaman yang terinfeksi di sekitar area penanaman. Jangan biarkan sisa tanaman yang terinfeksi menumpuk karena bisa menjadi sumber infeksi baru.
